subject: Economics
title: Progressive Taxation: Making the Rich Pay More
description: A quick win: understand Progressive Taxation: Making the Rich Pay More.

hook.text: In 1944, the US taxed income over $200,000 at 94%. The economy boomed.

buildup.text: Progressive taxation: higher earners pay a higher percentage.

discovery.text: The US, UK, and most developed nations used high top tax rates from the 1940s-1970s.

twist.text: Warren Buffett famously noted he pays a lower effective tax rate than his secretary.

climax.text: Tax policy is the most direct tool for reducing inequality.

punchline.text: History's highest growth happened under history's highest tax rates.

quiz.question: What was the top US income tax rate in 1944?
